summary.para: Extracts a single subregion (a "slice") of an input tensor.
The elements copied in the slice are determined using three values for each dimension.

item.description: The offset marks the first element to copy in a dimension.
The size marks the number of elements to copy in a dimension.
The stride indicates the element increment or step in a dimension.

summary.para: The provided Offsets, Sizes, and Strides must only copy elements that are within the bounds of the input tensor (out-of-bounds reads are not permitted). The Sizes of the slice must exactly match the output tensor sizes. In general, the elements copied are calculated as follows.

member.name: DML_SLICE_OPERATOR_DESC.InputTensor
member.summary: The tensor to extract slices from.

member.name: DML_SLICE_OPERATOR_DESC.OutputTensor
member.summary: The tensor to write the sliced data results to.

member.name: DML_SLICE_OPERATOR_DESC.DimensionCount
member.summary: The number of dimensions. This field determines the size of the Offsets, Sizes, and Strides arrays. This value must match the DimensionCount of the input and output tensors. This value must be between 1 and 8, inclusively, starting from DML_FEATURE_LEVEL_3_0; earlier feature levels require a value of either 4 or 5.

member.name: DML_SLICE_OPERATOR_DESC.Offsets
member.summary: An array containing the slice's start along each dimension of the input tensor, in elements.

member.name: DML_SLICE_OPERATOR_DESC.Sizes
member.summary: An array containing the slice's size along each dimension, in elements. The values in this array must match the sizes specified in the output tensor.

member.name: DML_SLICE_OPERATOR_DESC.Strides
member.summary: An array containing the slice's stride along each dimension of the input tensor, in elements. A stride larger than 1 indicates that elements of the input tensor may be skipped (for example, a stride of 2 will select every second element along the dimension).
